content.body: i can't imagine it working any other way

“Rethrows” sometimes could act differently from “doesn’t catch” with respect to things like dev tools (with the latter being more useful). This is actually a potential advantage of a built in catch guard construct, but could also add significant implementation complexity
content.formatted_body: “Rethrows” sometimes could act differently from “doesn’t catch” with respect to things like dev tools (with the latter being more useful). This is actually a potential advantage of a built in catch guard construct, but could also add significant implementation complexity

content.body: (The complexity comes when you need to evaluate JS to determine whether the guard hits, but then go back and “don’t catch” as if that didn’t happen)
